response.overview: Altar.  Dried blood streams and snow  Sticking and unravelling  Messy fragments of limbs  Deep black appeals  Escape into the realm of the lost  The toes of the statues of the gods are scattered  Hacking the world  Half-performed rituals hang in the air  Echoing  ......  Pleasure must give way to survival  Health has become the supreme rule  So pleasure must be sacrificed on the altar  People have made a revolution in their circle of friends  And think they've succeeded  It's not unlike what happens in the theatre.  ......  * The last toe, meaning the little toe of the human foot,  Derived from our relationship to the world:  i.e. the relationship between the foot and the shoe.
response.title: The Last Toe
